  • Constructor Details

    • ConstructorIO

      public ConstructorIO​(String apiToken, String apiKey, boolean isHTTPS, String host, String constructorToken)
      Creates a constructor.io Client.
      Parameters:
      apiToken - API Token, gotten from your Constructor.io Dashboard, and kept secret.
      apiKey - API Key, used publically in your in-site javascript client.
      isHTTPS - true to use HTTPS, false to use HTTP. It is highly recommended that you use HTTPS.
      host - The host of the autocomplete service that you are using. It is recommended that you let this value be null, in which case the host defaults to the Constructor.io autocomplete servic at ac.cnstrc.com.
      constructorToken - The token provided by Constructor to identify your company's traffic if proxying requests for results

    • ConstructorIO

      public ConstructorIO​(String apiToken, String apiKey, boolean isHTTPS, String host)
      Creates a constructor.io Client.
      Parameters:
      apiToken - API Token, gotten from your Constructor.io Dashboard, and kept secret.
      apiKey - API Key, used publically in your in-site javascript client.
      isHTTPS - true to use HTTPS, false to use HTTP. It is highly recommended that you use HTTPS.
      host - The host of the autocomplete service that you are using. It is recommended that you let this value be null, in which case the host defaults to the Constructor.io autocomplete servic at ac.cnstrc.com.

    • ConstructorIO

      public ConstructorIO​(String apiToken, String apiKey, boolean isHTTPS, String host, int port)

      Sets apiKey

    • verify

      public boolean verify() throws ConstructorException
      Verifies that an autocomplete service is working.
      Returns:
      true if working.
      Throws:
      ConstructorException - if the service is not working

    • addItem

      public boolean addItem​(ConstructorItem item, String autocompleteSection) throws ConstructorException
      Adds an item to your autocomplete.
      Parameters:
      item - the item that you're adding.
      autocompleteSection - the section of the autocomplete that you're adding the item to.
      Returns:
      true if working
      Throws:
      ConstructorException - if the request is invalid.

    • addOrUpdateItem

      Parameters:

      autocompleteSection - the section of the autocomplete that you're adding the item to.
      Returns:
      true if working
      Throws:
      ConstructorException - if the request is invalid.

    • addItemBatch

      public boolean addItemBatch​(ConstructorItem[] items, String autocompleteSection) throws ConstructorException
      Adds multiple items to your autocomplete (limit of 1000 items)
      Parameters:
      items - the items you want to add.
      autocompleteSection - the section of the autocomplete that you're adding the items to.
      Returns:
      true if working
      Throws:
      ConstructorException - if the request is invalid.

    • addOrUpdateItemBatch

      autocompleteSection - the section of the autocomplete that you're adding the items to.
      Returns:
      true if working

    • removeItem

      public boolean removeItem​(ConstructorItem item, String autocompleteSection) throws ConstructorException
      Removes an item from your autocomplete.
      Parameters:
      item - the item that you're removing.
      autocompleteSection - the section of the autocomplete that you're removing the item from.
      Returns:
      true if successfully removed
      Throws:
      ConstructorException - if the request is invalid.

    • modifyItem

      public boolean modifyItem​(ConstructorItem item, String autocompleteSection, String previousItemName) throws ConstructorException
      Modifies an item from your autocomplete.
      Parameters:
      item - the item that you're modifying.
      autocompleteSection - the section of the autocomplete that you're modifying the item for.
      previousItemName - the previous name of the item.
      Returns:
      true if successfully modified
      Throws:
      ConstructorException - if the request is invalid.

    • autocomplete

      public AutocompleteResponse autocomplete​(AutocompleteRequest req, UserInfo userInfo) throws ConstructorException
      Queries the autocomplete service. Note that if you're making an autocomplete request for a website, you should definitely use our javascript client instead of doing it server-side! That's important. That will be a solid latency difference.
      Parameters:
      req - the autocomplete request
      userInfo - optional information about the user
      Returns:
      an autocomplete response
      Throws:
      ConstructorException - if the request is invalid.

    • autocompleteAsJSON

      public String autocompleteAsJSON​(AutocompleteRequest req, UserInfo userInfo) throws ConstructorException
      Queries the autocomplete service. Note that if you're making an autocomplete request for a website, you should definitely use our javascript client instead of doing it server-side! That's important. That will be a solid latency difference.
      Parameters:
      req - the autocomplete request
      userInfo - optional information about the user
      Returns:
      a string of JSON
      Throws:
      ConstructorException - if the request is invalid.
